intro: Tenicroa unifolia, commonly known as the single-leaved tenicroa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
